snippet: The government’s failure to share information quickly contributed to worsening the outbreak, a panel that included experts from the World Health Organization said Saturday.
abstract: Study conducted by World Health Organization and South Korea finds South Korean government's failure to quickly share information with public and establish efficient disease-control system worsened outbreak of Middle East respiratory syndrome.
lead_paragraph: The government’s failure to share information quickly contributed to worsening the outbreak, a panel that included experts from the World Health Organization said Saturday.

headline.main: Experts Fault South Korean Response to MERS Outbreak
headline.print_headline: South Korea’s Response to MERS Cases Is Faulted
